item.title: The Court of Justice is deciding whether monks can be prohibited from practicing law, posing the question, "Can a man serve two masters?
item.description:
Rebecca Zahn, Senior Lecturer in Law, University of Strathclyde Lawyers in the European Union hold a distinctive position. They ensure access to justice, manage its administration, and uphold the rule of law within their Member States. Similar to other professions like medicine or architecture, national bodies strictly regulate entry. However, legal practice is inherently location-specific, unlike other professions. item.title: Brexit must ensure that health is not negatively impacted, which includes ensuring that there are adequate rules in place for medical professional qualifications.
item.description:
Professor Tamara Hervey from the University of Sheffield argues that a Leave.EU tweet claiming EU regulations unnecessarily extend doctor training is misleading. Hervey presents four key arguments: Firstly, the UK, as a long-standing EU member, significantly shaped EU medical training standards. While these standards do influence UK medical qualifications, their impact is limited, and the UK has the authority to propose changes. The current system, including the duration of training, reflects the UK’s active participation in shaping these regulations...
